content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 1 to node 10 in the provided graph is:

1->2->3->4->6->7->8->9->10

Note that this is the shortest path starting from node 1 and ending at node 10, ignoring the edge from node 0 to node 8 and from node 0 to node 12. If you change the endpoint to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point. In this case, the shortest path would be:

1->2->3->4->7

which is shorter than the original path by one step.

The shortest path from node 1 to node 4 in the provided graph is:

1->2->3->4

Note that this is the shortest path starting from node 1 and ending at node 4, ignoring the edges from node 0 to node 8 and from node 0 to node 12, and from node 8 to node 11. If you change the endpoint to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point. In this case, the shortest path would be:

1->2->3

which is shorter than the original path by one step.
